name: Pestana Vila Sol Golf & Resort Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Pestana, having previously holidayed here in 2009. We didn't enjoy it quite as much, and there don't appear to have been any improvements since Prestigia took it over from the previous hotel chain.
reviews.title: Not five star but OK for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the staff were very helpful. The trainee who checked us in was very good and also helpful when it came to sorting out places on the minibus which runs to the marina. This has been scaled back since we were last here, and we would have preferred a later departure in the evening and a return trip (the last one back is at 5:15pm).
reviews.title: Not a Five Star!!!!!

reviews.text: Last time we stayed in one of the 1800 garden rooms, which although close to the pool, was quiet and had a nice view. This time we had a 1200 room which had a smaller terrace and had the lake at the back of it. We weren't convinced about this and asked to move to one of the 1800 rooms but changed our mind when they said there would be a 25 euros per night supplement! To be fair, they offered us another of the 1200 rooms with a garden view for no extra cost but we eventually decided to stay put. The frogs croaking could be quite noisy and woke us up a couple of times but didn't bother us. The room decor is now looking dated but the quality of the furnishings is ok and the bathroom was huge with two sinks. The blackout curtains kept the morning sunshine at bay.
reviews.title: Pestana hotels normally have a much better standard.

reviews.text: Last time we stayed we quickly concluded the evening buffet wasn't worth the money (around 25 euros per person). This time, we ate at the Golf Clubhouse and had two courses and a bottle of wine for roughly the same price, with table service. The menu was a bit limited and it was a bit "chips with everything" but the salads were quite good. We did try Oscar's (at the entrance to the resort) for lunch one day but it didn't really live up to its billing as a gastropub. We also went into Vilamoura and over to Vale De Lobo one evening to eat.
reviews.title: WYSIWYG
A Great Round of Golf
reviews.text: Breakfast was fine - good quality and plenty of choice, although watch out for the ducks and birds going for your food, as some people insist on feeding them (despite the signs telling them not to).

We stayed here for 12 days from 9th July until 21st. It is a fantastic hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The pool area is excellent with plenty sun loungers and umbrellas. The gym was really good but definitely needs air conditioning as got far too hot even at 8.30 am. The drinks around the pool area were very expensive €3.85 for a Small coke! The location is not ideal as the nearest supermarket is 1.8 miles away or €8 in a taxi. The marina is also approx 3-4 miles away and a taxi was €10. The golf course at the hotel was fantastic and you get a good discount for being resident at hotel. Overall, a fantastic holiday at a beautiful hotel but too far away from shops and marina for me to return.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel with excellent service and very helpful staff

reviews.text: I stayed here for ten days for a relaxing 'get away from it all' break.
reviews.title: Fine. Not as relaxing/luxurious as some make out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many good points, first of which is the staff. (charming and very professional) Special mention to Elise at the front desk and her male colleague who I think was Jorge (young, very smiley), who went out of their way to help guests, and one other who was observed handling a rude American with great skill and more patience than he deserved.
reviews.title: if relaxing is what you are after!

reviews.text: Second is accommodation. There are rooms in the main hotel building and garden villa rooms. I was in one of the latter and found it very pleasant. Tired furniture etc but the sliding doors opened out onto a private patio area with sunbeds, table & chairs and then into a peaceful garden with shady trees and a stream/tinkling waterfall for pleasant relaxation and snoozing. The way the rooms are arranged meant I heard nothing at all from neighbours. The room was given a cursory clean daily.
reviews.title: Good for some things
Fantastic, relaxing, simply perfect
reviews.text: Third is breakfast which is well worth a mention. Three large serving stations: one for hot, one for fruit, yogurts, and cold meats and fish etc and one for breads, pastries and cereals. There is also an egg station where you can get your eggs done any way you wish. Tables on the patio are lovely and waiter service was always top quality. To avoid kids running riot, it's good to go a bit earlier (say 8.30 ish).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just arrived back from this hotel I only have good things to say. I was moved to this hotel as there was a mix up in my booking. I do not think this could have worked out any better for us. My husband wanted to play golf and there was a 27 hole course. He played this course 4 days out of the 5 although he did not pay for the buggy. Our accomdation was excellent and the complex was large and clean. Yes the rooms could do with wi-fi but isn't it nice to get away? I would just like to say a BIG thank you to all the staff (especially the front desk) for making our stay so wonderful.
reviews.title: Great Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was the same each morning but there was plenty to eat, I did not try the spa but I did enjoy the pool.
reviews.title: Golf & Sun (Lots of Sun)

reviews.text: Travelling with my wife, my mate and his wife, we booked this 5 night trip based on 2 previous visits to the Hotel/Resort, the last time being 2 years ago. We recommended to our friends when considering the Hotel facilities, the quality and size of the pool, the service throughout the resort and for the quality and challenge of the golf course.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel for a week away!!

reviews.text: We've stayed in the Tivoli on the Marina on 3 occasions, and as great as it is, and its is, however just different...Vila Sol is better located for the proximity to the cracking Championship Course, although the other Vilamoura courses are all within 5 to 10 Mins via Shuttle or car of the hotel. As most of the previous reviews state, 5 to 10 Mins maximum in a taxi at 10 Euros is more than acceptable.
reviews.title: A great place to stay for a golfing break

reviews.text: The Hotel rooms are very good, always clean, huge double bed.. HUGE..., limited stock in mini- bar, no tea/coffee in room also a minor issue. Very good breakfast, in fact, my memory of the restaurant was that it could probably do with a bit of a refurbishment, there may have been previous comments to that effect, however, the bench style seating along the interior walls had all been replaced, as had all the tables and chairs, my guess at fairly reasonable expense, good work.
reviews.title: a clean comfortable hotel
Clean, relaxing and a lot of fun
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night during a bus tour across Spain and Portugal. Let me tell you, I wish we had stayed here for a week. It is amazing!

The rooms are more like little condos, attached to one another in different sections. We were in section 15. The room (1501) was large, clean and modern. We had a very large bed (King size) and a lovely spacious bathroom. The air conditioning worked wonderfully as well. I had a wonderful night's sleep. We also had a patio area with chairs.
reviews.title: Wedding in Pestana Vila Sol

reviews.text: I was looking forward to this pool and it did not disappoint. We stayed there during the week, so it was not crowded. There were plenty of chairs and towels for everyone. The pool is large so there is plenty of space to swim around. Make sure to ask for your towel card back after you are done with your towels, because you need to give it back at check-out.
reviews.title: A resort for golf-lovers with a great pool.
Enjoyed every minute...
reviews.text: Wifi is available for free in the lobby area only, but there are about a dozen sofas for people to sit and relax.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to opt out of the buffet dinner that was served that night at the hotel. Instead, we chose to have a few tapas and drinks at the pool bar. Later, we came up to the main bar close to the lobby and had Portuguese appetizers, sandwiches and drinks. The food was excellent and the service was lovely. It took quite a while to get our food however, but the bar tender/waiter was so nice to us that we did not mind waiting around.
reviews.title: Good value, great staff, will come again!

aka: Pestana Vila Sol Golf And Resort Hotel
description: Pestana Vila Sol is located 5 minutes from Vilamoura and a 10 minutes ride to Marina de Vilamoura and the beaches. It has a 27 hole golf course, extensive green areas, fountains and small lakes.
